titleNullable: Amazon Product Reviews for Defect Analysis
subtitleNullable: Product Defect Analysis Using Consumers Feedback from Online Reviews
descriptionNullable:
Please Cite the Publication in which this novel dataset has been utilized: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10660-021-09495-8

Identifying product defects has increasingly received researchers ' attention and assists various stakeholders in effectively removing product defects. This study proposed the robust defective products’ identification framework and examined un-investigated review textual features. An innovative set of discrete emotions, psychological, and linguistic features is proposed. 

1. S No: This feature represents each review's serial number or index. It serves as a unique identifier for each review in the dataset.

2. Category: This feature indicates the category or type of the product being reviewed. It provides information about the product's specific category, such as electronics, books, clothing, etc.

3. ProductRelease: This feature indicates the product's release date being reviewed. It provides information about when the product was launched or made available to the public.

4. PositiveReviews: This feature represents the number of positive reviews received for the product. It indicates the count of reviews with positive or favourable feedback.

5. CriticalReviews: This feature represents the number of critical or negative reviews received for the product. It indicates the count of reviews with negative or unfavourable feedback.

6. TotalReviews: This feature represents the total number of reviews received for the product. It includes both positive and negative reviews.

7. ProductRating: This feature indicates the average rating or score assigned to the product based on customer reviews. It represents the overall satisfaction level of customers with the product, typically on a scale of 1 to 5 stars.

8. ReviewRating: This feature represents the rating or score assigned to the specific review. It indicates the individual reviewer's rating for their review.

9. ReviewTitle: This feature contains the title or headline of the review. It provides a summary or description of the main subject or opinion expressed in the review.

10. ReviewDate: This feature indicates when the reviewer posted or wrote the review.

11. ReviewBody: This feature contains the main text or content of the review. It includes detailed feedback, opinions, experiences, or comments the reviewer shares about the product.

12. TotalComments: This feature represents the total number of comments received on the review. It indicates the engagement or interaction level of other users with the review.

13. ReviewStatus: This is the target class or the dependent variable in a binary classification problem. It indicates the status or sentiment of the review, typically categorized as positive or negative based on the overall sentiment expressed in the review.

These features provide valuable information about the crawled Amazon reviews, including product details, customer ratings, review content, and sentiment. They can be used for analyses and machine learning tasks, such as sentiment analysis, review classification, or predicting review sentiment.

Please Cite the Publication in which this novel dataset has been utilized: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10660-021-09495-8
